oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Account of pay for Confederate officer Newton J. Lillard
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pay account to Newton J. Lillard for $370.00 signed by Quartermaster Captain George W. Allen. Remarks read, "Splendid officer, gets drunk pretty often, which takes most of my money, as we have to pay such high prices for whiskey can't you rase the Col. wages? I would like to be promoted." Message in pencil on the reverse comments on the "rights to a seat in the next legislature." Unusual script appears on reverse in ink.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay.
